TabTab 2.0 - The Biggest Update Yet

This is a free update for all users.

üé® Fresh New Look

TabTab has a new look to better align with macOS 26. Redesigned icon and website at tabtabapp.net

üìÇ Tabs Grouped by Windows

Many users have said that TabTab doesn't fit naturally into their existing workflows. This feature is a step towards making TabTab more natural to use.

  • Tabs are now grouped by default, according to their window. You can click on the number to the right of the tab to see all other tabs in that same window.
  • When you start searching, TabTab shows all relevant tabs, regardless of their tab groups.
  • You can also use the left and right arrows to navigate in and out of the new grouped tabs page.
  • You can turn this off in settings to display all tabs at the same time.

üë®‚Äçüîß Improved Tab Tracking Reliability

  • Significantly improved tab tracking for many popular browsers: Google Chrome, Safari, Brave, Microsoft Edge.
  • Arc browser support (finally!!)
  • Browser favicons are now shown for these browsers in grouped tab mode
  • You can now search for tabs by their URL in these browsers

üëæ Other Big Improvements

  • All tabs are now registered on startup, you no longer have to click on them before they get added to TabTab.
  • TabTab now doubles as an app launcher when you search for apps that aren‚Äôt yet registered.
  • Redesigned onboarding flow
  • Redesigned settings
  • New option in settings to increase width of TabTab

üêõ Bug Fixes

  • Search box sometimes not getting focused when TabTab is presented
  • Block notification center from appearing for users using non-English system
  • Fix CMD+Q and CMD+W to quit apps and windows not working for some users
  • Fix input into search bar that requires IME confirmation box
  • Many more fixes

‚ù§Ô∏è Thank You

Thanks so much for your patience and for sharing your feedback ‚Äî it really helps make TabTab better.

Since TabTab isn't on the App Store, organic reviews on subreddits and across the internet make a huge difference. Please consider spreading the word about TabTab if you find it useful!

Feel free to join our Discord community at https://discord.gg/Rpm76NdN5J

Thank you again for using TabTab!
